Package ships

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
ships.Ship
Direct Known Subclasses:
Barge, Clipper, TallShip, WarShip
public abstract class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
The superclass of all ship types. A ship is a vessel for holding items, while simultaneously acting as "The Player". Each ship type has a number of unique statistics that can change how the game plays
Author:
Andrew Hall

  • Constructor Details

    • Ship

      public Ship​(float speed, java.lang.String shipType, java.lang.String description, int crew, int cargoCapacity, float repairCost, int startingMoney)
      Constructor, allowing the ship subclasses to specify what's unique about them
      Parameters:
      speed - The time a route takes is divided by speed e.g. 10 days / 2 speed = 5 days
      shipType - The ship's name e.g. "War Ship...
      description - An overview of the ship
      crew - Number of crew on the ship
      cargoCapacity - How many item weight can be carried
      repairCost - Every 1.0 damage taken costs this much to fix
      startingMoney - Better ships start you off with less money

  • Method Details

    • damageShip

      public void damageShip​(float damage) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Ships are damaged through random events (pirates, rocks...) and damage must be repaired
      Parameters:
      damage - The amount of damage to deal
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given damage is negative

    • getSpareCapacity

      public int getSpareCapacity()
      Calculates the amount of spare cargo capacity
      Returns:
      Amount of free cargo space

    • getCombatBonus

      public int getCombatBonus()
      Calculates the bonus received in combat, based on any upgrades in cargo
      Returns:
      The bonus given to rolls in combat

    • storeItem

      public void storeItem​(Item item) throws CargoFullException
      Adds an item to your ship's cargo. Note that it can be used for either trade goods, or upgrades.
      Note: The item is copied before adding, so don't worry about copying yourself
      Parameters:
      item - Item to add
      Throws:
      CargoFullException - If adding an item would exceed the cargo capacity

    • popItem

      public Item popItem​(int cargoIdx) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Removes the cargo at the given position and returns it
      Parameters:
      cargoIdx - Position of cargo (0 means first)
      Returns:
      The removed item
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • popItem

      public Item popItem​(java.lang.String name) throws ItemNotFoundException
      Searches the cargo hold by name, deletes it from cargo, and returns it
      Parameters:
      name - The text name of the item
      Returns:
      The item in question
      Throws:
      ItemNotFoundException - If the given itemName doesn't match anything in cargo

    • hasInCargo

      public boolean hasInCargo​(Item searchingFor)
      Checks if the ship has any cargo with the same name
      Parameters:
      searchingFor - The item that you want to find
      Returns:
      Was it in the cargo

    • removeAllCargo

      public java.util.ArrayList<Item> removeAllCargo()
      Removes all the cargo from the ship, and returning it.
      Returns:
      The ship's (former) cargo.

    • repairShip

      public int repairShip()
      Removes all damage to the ship, calculating what the repairs cost
      Returns:
      The cost of repairing the ship
